hints.content:
The number line shows $\maroonD{5}$ equal jumps of $\blueD{4}$ units.

![The same number line with each arrow labeled, plus 4](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/0bd83ccf5cf4970e601c6f0f4fe13e005bfa339f)

options.explanation:
We can reach the same total using $\blueD{4}$ equal jumps of $\maroonD{5}$ units.

![A number line labeled 0, 5, 10, 15, 20. Arrows labeled, plus 5, point right from each number to the next.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/1c356e8589ef6304e512bf4da1b4e688ef2c0088)

$\blueD{4} \times \maroonD{5} = \underbrace{\maroonD{5}+\maroonD{5}+\maroonD{5}+\maroonD{5}}_{\blueD{4}\maroonD{\text{ fives}}}=\greenD{20}$

So $\maroonD{5}\times\blueD{4}=\greenD{20}$.

question.content:
**Multiply.**  
*Hint: Use the number line below to help solve the equation.* 

$5 \times 4 = $ [[☃ numeric-input 1]]
